summary.item: Promoted through progressive leadership roles; most recently serving as an organization-wide expert for mobile application development and system architecture.

Spearheaded the technical foundation for a ground-up native redesign of PNC’s retail banking application, adopting a “day zero, future-focused” approach that ensures project resilience against unforeseen executive requirement shifts.
Transformed potential technical debt into intentional architecture by identifying and extending patterns that mandate feature segregation, making haphazard modularization impossible to implement.

Enforced industry best practices (design tokens, color roles, linters) and introduced custom onboarding/troubleshooting scripts to facilitate seamless development across the redesigned app and design library.
Established foundational code maintenance and development patterns that were adopted by the organization’s change management team as institutional policy.
Led the technical stack for a flagship Android application supporting 3.5M+ active users, including the architecture and implementation of the in-app mobile payment processing platform.
Served as the primary technical evaluator for third-party integrations; reduced vendor pools from broad fields to 2–3 viable candidates by identifying technical incompatibilities early.
Bridged the gap between business and technology by educating executive leadership on the intersection of technical flows (e.g., OS permissions) and business logic.
Built a new authentication platform and successfully migrated 7M+ active users with zero downtime and helped the institution achieve Zelle network integration requirements (QR codes/deep-linking).

Directed a web development crew of 25+ developers at project peak for the online banking platform redesign, laying the groundwork for organization-wide patterns while coaching teammates on best practices in modern web development.
Delivered an Android FIDO authenticator proof-of-concept that spring-boarded the institutional adoption of Samsung Knox and multi-factor authentication (MFA).
Reduced deployment time for brand-specific white-label applications from days to hours through streamlined processes and tool enhancement.
